intro: Glochidion chademenosocarpum, commonly known as the Chademenosocarpum glochidion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, palmate leaves and produces yellowish-green flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. This species is often found in lowland and hill forest areas, growing in shaded, moist environments.
